page.title: 12HOUSING IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: At the time of the{last census (1981) {there were approx. 250 households,}70 of which had at least one pensioner,34 had children aged from 0-17. About{70% of the properties were {owner-occupied, 20% were rented}and the remainder were either linked to employment or Council-owned.{Most of {the houses are old (some over 200 {years)}stone-built cottages or farms. Whitehough Farm is dated 1593,and Sabden Hall 1577.{During the past {12-15years some new houses have been {built,}attracting business and professional people to live in the area,but whose work takes them else- where.{95% of households had inside {W.C. and bath,}but 5% lacked indoor W.C.-mainly outlying farms or cottages with no access to mains drainage.The situation remains much the same today.
